TestCase.Title: Test case EID_CLIENT_A2_28
TestCase.Purpose: Positive test describing the Connection (Re-)establishment between the eID-Client and the attached eID-Server.
TestCase.Precondition: A single basic card reader is connected to the eID-Client system.
A single active eID-Card is connected to the card reader.

TestStep.Description: [TC_TOKEN_URL] is a valid https-URL where the TC Token can be retrieved by the eID-Client.

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client is activated and starts establishment of channel TLS-2 to the TC Token Provider.

Command.Text: The eID-Server accepts the connection TLS-2.

TestStep.Description: The eID-Server uses TLS server certificate [CERT_TLS_ESERVICE_3_J] from [CERT_SET_3].

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client submits a HTTP GET to [TC_TOKEN_URL] via the channel TLS-2.

Command.Text: Check if the eID-Client requests the TC Token via the provided URL and respond to the eID-Client with a valid TC Token.

TestStep.Description: The HTTP response containing TC Token has "Content-Type: text/xml" and "charset=utf-8". The response does not contain any further content besides TC Token.
TC Token contains the default parameters.
Parameter "SessionIdentifier" is randomly set to value [SID].
The XML elements "PathSecurity-Protocol" and "PathSecurity-Parameters" are missing since the eID-Server is attached.

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Server receives the message "StartPAOS" via connection TLS-2. No additional TLS channel is established.

Command.Text: Validate the message "StartPAOS" to be conform to the description in section "StartPAOS".

ExpectedResult.Text: The element "UserAgent" matches the statement in the ICS.
The one or more elements "SupportedAPIVersions" are conform to the requirements of [TR-03112].

Command.Text: The eID-Server invokes "DIDAuthenticate_EAC1InputType" and sends a close_notify message on the TLS layer immediately afterwards.

TestStep.Description: The message "DIDAuthenticate_EAC1InputType" contains the parameters "Certificate" and "CertificateDescription".
The certificate chain from [CERT_SET_1] is sent in given order: [CERT_CV_TERM_1_A], [CERT_CV_DV_1_A].

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client displays EAC data received from the eID-Server before the user enters his PIN.

Command.Text: Do not change CertificateHolderAuthorizationTemplate and enter the correct PIN of the eID-Card.

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client resumes the previously closed TLS session using Session Resumption.
The eID-Client responds with the message "DIDAuthenticateResponse_EAC1OutputType".
The message contains at least the following elements: "Result", "EFCardAccess", "IDPICC" and "Challenge".
The element "Result" contains exactly one element "ResultMajor" which equals /resultmajor#ok.
The element "EFCardAccess" matches the card file EF.CardAccess.
